news.title: Academic who came under fire from Michael D Higgins considered for Fianna Fáil presidential run
news.summary: The leading academic who chaired the Government’s public consultation on defence and security, Louise Richardson, is among the names being considered as Fianna Fáil’s candidate for the presidential election.

news.title: Former Sinn Féin press officer jailed for child sexual offences is released from prison
news.summary: Former Sinn Féin press officer Michael McMonagle has been released from prison after his jailing for online child sex offences.

news.title: Ivana Bacik defends Catherine Connolly as presidential pick despite attack by former Labour leader Alan Kelly
news.summary: Labour leader Ivana Bacik says her party is proud to back Catherine Connolly for the presidency, despite senior TD Alan Kelly openly challenging the decision.

news.title: Weather warning for six counties as Met Éireann warn of localised flooding and thunderstorms
news.summary: A Status Yellow rain warning is in place for six counties as heavy rain may lead to localised flooding and difficult travelling conditions until this evening.

news.title: Meet the Irish players that helped Grimsby pull off the shock of the season by knocking out Manchester United from League Cup
news.summary: The outpouring of emotion at the final whistle told you everything about how much this meant to Grimsby Town and their supporters, many of whom flooded the pitch as delirium descended on Blundell Park.

news.title: Cian Healy on how he got hooked on knife-making: ‘I found I could just disappear into the work’
news.summary: Former Ireland rugby international Cian Healy has a passion for knife-making. Healy says it is a creative counterbalance to the pressures of professional sport.

news.title: Asian hornet nest found in Cork City as public advised not to approach suspected sightings
news.summary: An Asian hornet nest has been identified near Cork City, following further sightings of the insects which can pose a significant threat to honeybee populations.

news.title: ‘The cost of feeding the students is the biggest expense’ – how much money can a Bean an Tí make?
news.summary: It has become a rite of passage for Irish teenagers. A few weeks in the Gaeltacht to improve their proficiency of our native tongue is the objective, but arguably for the youngsters, it’s even more about making friends, having fun and maybe that first summer romance.

news.title: Adrian Weckler: Google’s AI videos are so good you won’t believe your eyes – though you might be right not to
news.summary: Most of us are now familiar with online AI platforms such as ChatGPT, Gemini, Anthropic or even Grok. They’re becoming common for search queries, research, writing emails and lots of other things.

news.title: First group of Palestinian students to arrive in Ireland today as over 50 offered scholarships
news.summary: More than 50 Palestinian students will arrive from Gaza in the coming days, having been offered scholarships to study in Ireland.
